method.name: Association Rule Tree

reference.ref: F. Berzal, J.C. Cubero, D. Sanchez, J.M. Serrano. Serrano.ART: A Hybrid Classification Model. Machine Learning 54 (2004) 67-92.

generalDescription.objective: To determine a set of rules that predicts correctly the value of the target attribute
generalDescription.howWork: This method induces a set of rules based on ideas from the association rule mining context. It builds decision lists that can be viewed as degenerate, polythetic decision trees, by means of a Separate and Conquer strategy.

method.example:
Problem type: Classification Method: ART Dataset: wisconsin Training set: wisconsin.dat Test set: wisconsin.dat Test Show results: Vis-Clas-Check Parameters: default values
After the execution of RunKeel.jar we can see into the experiment\results\Vis-Clas-Check folder the classification results for the test and train set:
TEST RESULTS ============ Classifier= Fold 0 : CORRECT=0.9692532942898975 N/C=0.0 Global Classification Error + N/C: 0.03074670571010249 stddev Global Classification Error + N/C: 0.0 Correctly classified: 0.9692532942898975 Global N/C: 0.0
TRAIN RESULTS ============ Classifier= Summary of data, Classifiers: Fold 0 : CORRECT=0.9692532942898975 N/C=0.0 Global Classification Error + N/C: 0.03074670571010249 stddev Global Classification Error + N/C: 0.0 Correctly classified: 0.9692532942898975 Global N/C: 0.0
